page.title: 03In the 1950's
page.content: In the 1950's the main change on the farms was that horses were superceded by the mechanical age. Instead of the farmer having horses and employing grooms the farmer now had tractors and tractor men. The work of twenty farm labourers was now done by three, which accounted for the decrease in village population at this period. Many of the young men of the village went into industry after their National Service. The only horses seen in the village were used mainly for hunting and pleasure. Though there was a horse drawn carrier's van which travelled to Cheltenham three times a week, taking three hours to get there and four hours for the return journey, which was uphill. Even this stopped when the new coach service started late in the 1950's.
